column2: Does the brand have a code that addresses labor standards?
column3: Does the code include elimination of child labor?
column4: Does the code include abolition of forced or compulsory labor?
column5: Does the code include freedom of association?
column6: Does the code include rights to collective bargaining?
column7: Does the code prohibit discrimination on the basis of personal attributes or affiliations?
column8: Does the code prohibit use of regular and excessive overtime?
column9: Are suppliers required to ensure freedom of movement for employees and their right to leave and enter work voluntarily?
column10: Are suppliers prohibited from using recruitment fees?
column11: Does the code apply to multiple levels of the supply chain?
column12: Is the code included in supplier contracts?
column13: Does the brand have a policy of non-interference toward trade unions and worker organizing?
column14: Has the brand taken steps to use responsible purchasing practices?
column15: Does brand have a policy that addresses subcontracting in the supply chain (inlcuding homework)?*
column16: Does the brand monitor at least 75% of its direct CMT suppliers annually?*
column17: Does the brand monitor at least 75% of its inputs suppliers annually? (one input
column18: Does the brand monitor at least 75% of its raw materials suppliers annually? (one raw material)
column19: Does the brand monitor at least 75% of its CMT suppliers with unannounced visits or off-site worker interviews?*
